intro: Sida cardiophylla, commonly known as the heartleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Sida cardiophylla is often found in wetlands and along riverbanks, where it thrives in moist, sunny conditions.
